title: 820-00165 green light no power
message:
Hi guys.

I have this 820-00165 board no green light missing PPBUS_G3H. Someone played around with smc so i resoldered it. I also replaced U7501, there was a missing backlight IC i've soldered a new one and also replacedU7100. I  finally managed to get a green light but no power. Diode mode on R5100 pin 1 id 0.3 and pin 2 0.5 voltages also correct. I noted something strange on C7094 on pin 1 (P3V42G3H_BOOST) i have 7.2V and pin 2 is ok it's 3.4v.
PPBUS_G3H is 0.2v
PP5V_S5 is 0.8v
PP3V3_S5 is 0.8v
J6100 removed

Any ideas?  

Thanks :D

title: 820-00165 green light no power
message:
First post diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H; be sure F7100 is good.
Post U7100 voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

title: 820-00165 green light no power
message:
F7140 is good.  PPBUS_G3H diode mode on F7410 pin 2 0.46 and pin 1 is 0.116 when F7410 removed.
U7100:
pin 1 0.26v, pin 2 12.8v, pin 3 3.9v, pin 9 4.2v, pin 12 3.4v, pin 13 3.4v, pin 14 3.4v, pin 15 0.28, pin 17 0.8v, pin 19 5.3v, pin 20 5.3v, pin 27 14.2v

title: 820-00165 green light no power
message:
"pin 9 4.2v"
Are you sure about this?
Check R7121/22 and their traces.
Also be sure R7105 has correct value.

title: 820-00165 green light no power
message: I replaced R7105, R7121/22 they were bad now it's the correct value on all of them and on Pin 9 now i have 0.8v but i think this u7100 is not good :D

title: 820-00165 green light no power

title: 820-00165 green light no power
message: I replaced another 2 new and from another board still same. Now pin 9 is 0.7 diode value which is correct and 0v

title: 820-00165 green light no power
message: Thought i'd chip in here as i've been trolled by these before - if either U7100 or Q7130 has or had a fault they will tend to burn the other one. So if you had a short on U7100 then you need to replace Q7130, if you replaced U7100 without replacing Q7130 you have probably killed the new U7100. Replace both Q7130 and U7100 with new and try. Also check resistance to ground at L7310 - if it's low 1-2ohms you have got a dead processor and basically a trash board so don't waste any time if this is the case!

I can replace Q7130 and u7100 no problem but it was showing 0v on  PPBUS_G3H  maybe it needed cleaning from flux u7100
